Class SignatureUtil

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.crypt.SignatureUtil
public final class SignatureUtil extends Object
Utility class for digital signatures.

    • sign

      public static byte[] sign(PrivateKey privateKey, byte[] data, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Sign data using a private key.
      Parameters:
      privateKey - the private key for signing
      data - the data to sign
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      the digital signature
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if signing fails

    • sign

      public static byte[] sign(PrivateKey privateKey, CharSequence text) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Sign text using a private key.
      Parameters:
      privateKey - the private key for signing
      text - the text to sign
      Returns:
      the digital signature as Base64 encoded String
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if signing fails

    • sign

      public static byte[] sign(PrivateKey privateKey, char[] text, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Sign text using a private key.

      Security Note: This method clears (overwrites with null characters) the input char array after use to prevent sensitive data from remaining in memory. Do not reuse the same array for subsequent operations.

      Parameters:
      privateKey - the private key for signing
      text - the text to sign
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      the digital signature as Base64 encoded String
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if signing fails

    • verify

      public static boolean verify(PublicKey publicKey, byte[] data, byte[] signature, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Verify a digital signature.
      Parameters:
      publicKey - the public key for verification
      data - the original data that was signed
      signature - the digital signature to verify
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      true if the signature is valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if verification fails

    • verify

      public static boolean verify(PublicKey publicKey, CharSequence text, byte[] signature) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Verify a digital signature for text.
      Parameters:
      publicKey - the public key for verification
      text - the original text that was signed
      signature - the digital signature as Base64 encoded String
      Returns:
      true if the signature is valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if verification fails

    • verify

      public static boolean verify(PublicKey publicKey, char[] text, byte[] signature, InputBufferHandling inputBufferHandling) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Verify a digital signature for text.

      Security Note: This method clears (overwrites with null characters) the input char array after use to prevent sensitive data from remaining in memory. Do not reuse the same array for subsequent operations.

      Parameters:
      publicKey - the public key for verification
      text - the original text that was signed
      signature - the digital signature
      inputBufferHandling - how to handle input buffers
      Returns:
      true if the signature is valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if verification fails

    • createSignedData

      public static org.bouncycastle.cms.CMSSignedData createSignedData(PrivateKey developerPrivateKey, X509Certificate certificate, byte[] certificateBytes) throws org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException, CertificateEncodingException, org.bouncycastle.cms.CMSException
      Creates a CMSSignedData object by signing the input data (certificate bytes) using the provided private key and certificate.
      Parameters:
      developerPrivateKey - the private key used to sign the data
      certificate - the X509Certificate used in the signing process
      certificateBytes - the byte array representation of the certificate to be signed
      Returns:
      a CMSSignedData object containing the signed data
      Throws:
      org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException - if there is an error creating the content signer or signature generator
      CertificateEncodingException - if there is an error encoding the certificate
      org.bouncycastle.cms.CMSException - if there is an error in generating the signed data
